summary: The Enhanced Iran Sanctions Act of 2025 aims to impose sanctions on foreign entities involved in the processing, export, or sale of Iranian oil, gas, and petrochemical products. It outlines specific sanctions, including blocking of property and visa restrictions, while providing waivers under certain conditions. The bill establishes an Interagency Working Group on Iranian Sanctions and encourages cooperation with international partners to enforce sanctions and counter Iranian malign activities. It also amends existing law to facilitate private sector reporting on sanctionable activities and sanctions evasion related to Iranian energy exports.
